title: Great Chimbu Pig Festival
creator_credit: Papua New Guinea. Dept. of Information and Extension Services
brief_description: Examines in detail the great festival of the Chimbu people of the Central Highlands of New Guinea. The festival is usually performed every five to eight years but Western influences have contributed to the seventeen year gap since the last ceremony. It is recommended that teachers preview this film before screening.
